channel.title: Anyone seen "the karate kid" and remember this quote?
channel.description:
a character in that film says something like this
Mr. Miyagi: "listen Daniel-san, you have learned defensive blocks while painting my fence"
thats just after the main character gets fed up of doing all the gardening, painting the fence and sweeping the floor, then that other character tells him that does anyone remember the [b]exact[/b] words of that? i need it to make an analogy about how what i teach is useful even if people dont see why right now

item.title: Anyone seen "the karate kid" and remember this quote?
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

I've waxed your car, I paint your house, paint your fence.
  • Not everything is as seems.
  • Bullshit! I’m going home, man.

They never said bullshit in the movie :|…

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone seen "the karate kid" and remember this quote?
